documentation:
Amazon Cognito Sync

Amazon Cognito Sync provides an AWS service and client library that enable cross-device syncing of application-related user data. High-level client libraries are available for both iOS and Android. You can use these libraries to persist data locally so that it's available even if the device is offline. Developer credentials don't need to be stored on the mobile device to access the service. You can use Amazon Cognito to obtain a normalized user ID and credentials. User data is persisted in a dataset that can store up to 1 MB of key-value pairs, and you can have up to 20 datasets per user identity.

With Amazon Cognito Sync, the data stored for each identity is accessible only to credentials assigned to that identity. In order to use the Cognito Sync service, you need to make API calls using credentials retrieved with Amazon Cognito Identity service.

DeleteDataset.name: DeleteDataset

IdentityPoolId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

IdentityId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

DatasetName.documentation:
A string of up to 128 characters.
      Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.'
      (dot).

input.documentation:
A request to delete the specific
      dataset.

IdentityId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

DatasetName.documentation:
A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed characters
      are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

CreationDate.documentation:
Date on which the dataset was
      created.

LastModifiedDate.documentation:
Date when the dataset was last
      modified.

LastModifiedBy.documentation:
The device that made the last change to this
      dataset.

DataStorage.documentation:
Total size in bytes of the records in this
      dataset.

NumRecords.documentation: Number of records in this dataset.

Dataset.documentation:
A collection of data for an identity pool.
      An identity pool can have multiple datasets. A dataset is per identity and can be general or
      associated with a particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are
      automatically created if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold
      up to 1MB of key-value pairs.

output.documentation:
Response to a successful DeleteDataset
      request.

message.documentation:
The message returned by a
      NotAuthorizedException.

errors.documentation:
Thrown when a user is not authorized to access the
      requested resource.

Thrown when a request parameter does not comply
      with the associated constraints.

Thrown if the resource doesn't
      exist.

Indicates an internal service
      error.

DeleteDataset.documentation:
Deletes the specific dataset. The dataset will be deleted
      permanently, and the action can't be undone. Datasets that this dataset was merged with will
      no longer report the merge. Any consequent operation on this dataset will result in a
      ResourceNotFoundException.

DatasetName.documentation:
A string of up to 128 characters.

input.documentation:
A request for metadata about a dataset (creation
      date, number of records, size) by owner and dataset name.

A name-spaced GUID (for example,

The device that made the last change to this
      dataset.

DataStorage.documentation:
Total size in bytes of the records in this
      dataset.

NumRecords.documentation: Number of records in this dataset.

Dataset.documentation:
Metadata for a collection of data for an
      identity. An identity can have multiple datasets. A dataset can be general or associated with
      a particular entity in an application (like a saved game). Datasets are automatically created
      if they don't exist. Data is synced by dataset, and a dataset can hold up to 1MB of key-value
      pairs.

Response to a successful DescribeDataset

message.documentation:
The message returned by a
      NotAuthorizedException.

errors.documentation:

Thrown when a request parameter does not comply
      with the associated constraints.

Thrown if the resource doesn't
      exist.

Indicates an internal service

DescribeDataset.documentation:
Gets metadata about a dataset by identity and dataset
      name. The credentials used to make
      this API call need to have access to the identity data. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
      identity has access only to its own data. You should use Amazon
         Cognito Identity service to retrieve the credentials necessary to make this API
      call.

DescribeIdentityPoolUsage.documentation:
Gets usage details (for example, data storage)

A collection of data for an identity pool. An identity pool can

ListDatasets.documentation:
Lists datasets for an identity. The credentials used to make
      this API call need to have access to the identity data. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
      identity has access only to its own data. You should use Amazon
         Cognito Identity service to retrieve the credentials necessary to make this API
      call.

ListRecords.name: ListRecords

IdentityPoolId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

IdentityId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

DatasetName.documentation:
A string of up to 128 characters. Allowed
      characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.' (dot).

LastSyncCount.documentation:
The last server sync count for this
      record.

NextToken.documentation:
A pagination token for obtaining the next
      page of results.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results to be
      returned.

SyncSessionToken.documentation:
A token containing a session ID,
      identity ID, and expiration.

input.documentation: A request for a list of records.

SyncCount.documentation: The server sync count for this record.

LastModifiedDate.documentation:
The date on which the record was last
      modified.

LastModifiedBy.documentation:
The user/device that made the last change to this
      record.

DeviceLastModifiedDate.documentation:
The last modified date of the client
      device.

members.documentation: The basic data structure of a dataset.

NextToken.documentation:
A pagination token for obtaining the next
      page of results.

DatasetSyncCount.documentation:
Server sync count for this
      dataset.

LastModifiedBy.documentation:
The user/device that made the last
      change to this record.

DatasetDeletedAfterRequestedSyncCount.documentation:
A boolean value
      specifying whether to delete the dataset locally.

SyncSessionToken.documentation:
A token containing a session ID,
      identity ID, and expiration.

errors.documentation:
Thrown when a request parameter does not comply
      with the associated constraints.

message.documentation:
The message returned by a
      NotAuthorizedException.

errors.documentation:
Thrown when a user is not authorized to access the
      requested resource.

Thrown if the request is
      throttled.

Indicates an internal service
      error.

ListRecords.documentation:
Gets paginated records, optionally changed after a particular
      sync count for a dataset and identity. The credentials used to make
      this API call need to have access to the identity data. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
      identity has access only to its own data. You should use Amazon
         Cognito Identity service to retrieve the credentials necessary to make this API
      call.

UpdateRecords.name: UpdateRecords

IdentityPoolId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

IdentityId.documentation:
A name-spaced GUID (for example,
      us-east-1:23EC4050-6AEA-7089-A2DD-08002EXAMPLE) created by Amazon Cognito. GUID generation is
      unique within a region.

DatasetName.documentation:
A string of up to 128 characters.
      Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (dash), and '.'
      (dot).

Op.documentation: An operation, either replace or remove.

Key.documentation: The key associated with the record patch.

Value.documentation:
The value associated with the record
      patch.

SyncCount.documentation:
Last known server sync count for this record. Set
      to 0 if unknown.

DeviceLastModifiedDate.documentation:
The last modified date of the client
      device.

members.documentation: An update operation for a record.

SyncSessionToken.documentation:
The SyncSessionToken returned by a
      previous call to ListRecords for this dataset and identity.

ClientContext.documentation: Intended to supply a device ID that will populate the lastModifiedBy field referenced in other methods. The ClientContext field is not yet implemented.

input.documentation:
A request to post updates to records or add and
      delete records for a dataset and user.

SyncCount.documentation: The server sync count for this record.

LastModifiedDate.documentation:
The date on which the record was last
      modified.

LastModifiedBy.documentation:
The user/device that made the last change to this
      record.

DeviceLastModifiedDate.documentation:
The last modified date of the client
      device.

members.documentation: The basic data structure of a dataset.

Records.documentation:
A list of records that have been
      updated.

errors.documentation:
Thrown when a request parameter does not comply
      with the associated constraints.

Thrown when the limit on the number of objects or
      operations has been exceeded.

message.documentation:
The message returned by a
      NotAuthorizedException.

errors.documentation:
Thrown when a user is not authorized to access the
      requested resource.

Thrown if the resource doesn't
      exist.

message.documentation:
The message returned by a
      ResourceConflictException.

errors.documentation:
Thrown if an update can't be applied because
      the resource was changed by another call and this would result in a conflict.

Thrown if the request is
      throttled.

Indicates an internal service
      error.

UpdateRecords.documentation:
Posts updates to records and add and delete records for a
      dataset and user. The credentials used to make
      this API call need to have access to the identity data. With Amazon Cognito Sync, each
      identity has access only to its own data. You should use Amazon
         Cognito Identity service to retrieve the credentials necessary to make this API
      call.
